metadata.title: Insect Lidar Supervised Classification
metadata.description:
This repository contains the code used to create the results and figures in our paper Detection of Insects in Class-imbalanced Lidar Field Measurements, which was published in and presented at the 2021 IEEE Machine Learning for Signal Processing conference.

This release is archived on Zenodo at https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5504408

The data associated with this software is archived on Zenodo at https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5504410

Changelog

  • fix indexing bug in feature extraction code
  • fix bug in code that finds harmonics
metadata.notes: If you use this software, please cite it as below.

ai-ml-ops.name: mlsp2021-insect-lidar-supervised-classification
ai-ml-ops.description: Code for detecting insects in lidar data.  This repository contains the code used to create the results and figures in our paper Detection of Insects in Class-imbalanced Lidar Field Measurements, which was published in and presented at the 2021 IEEE Machine Learning for Signal Processing (MLSP) conference.

repo-profile.recommendation:

5. Consider implementing code generation tools to improve development speed and accuracy.
6. Explore incorporating artificial intelligence (AI) technologies to enhance software capabilities and functionality.

Github-metadata.GitHub_description: Code for detecting insects in lidar data.  This repository contains the code used to create the results and figures in our paper Detection of Insects in Class-imbalanced Lidar Field Measurements, which was published in and presented at the 2021 IEEE Machine Learning for Signal Processing (MLSP) conference.
GitHub_commits_messages:
Revert changes that aren't relevant to MLSP paper

This reverts commit
6fa6fa270054946d201106d9fff0aa938f035a79..b0c9a520752ed4152edec57121706d547410b497
models for teton and hyalite training data and models for teton only training data

Merge pull request #15 from BMW-lab-MSU/HannahDev3

Hannah's testing scripts
added MatLab code files and modified paths
update hyperparameter ranges and default layer size

[bug fix] replace incorrect harmonic finding code

The previous vectorized code found all peaks that were within a given
distance from a harmonic on either side. That is not what we want.
Rather, we want to find the closest peak to the theoretical harmonic
location for each harmonic (this is what findHarmonics does).

If the previous code found two peaks near the second harmonic, that
second peak would accidentally be considered the "third harmonic" peak,
which was incorrect.
[bug fix] change index from 1 to i
create directory so it doesn't have to exist beforehand

Update path and show neural net results

In the new experiments, the neural network performed better than
AdaBoost did, so we report confusion matrices for the neural net now.

Change parallel pool timeout

For some reason, the pool seemed to be timing out when AdaBoost threw
a warning or error, which would stop the tuning procedure; setting the
timeout to infinity solved the problem and let the tuning keep running
Use MCC as the objective; fix constant name

bug fix: combine labels correctly

Previously, the insect and "maybe insect" labels were being concatenated,
but they need to be OR'd together.
add other classifiers to testing script

Update imageConfusion for testing data; bug fixes

The testing labels are not in a cell array because there is only one partition
function to compute per-image confusoin matrix
optimize for F2 instead of MCC; MCC was not emphasizing recall enough
neural net tuning; show best confusion and fix save issue
fix save issue; change rng seed; show best confusion
tune sampling for shallow neural network

Parallelize data agumentation

The data augmentation was *really* slow, mostly due to findpeaks.
The time-consuming parts of the function are now parallelized.
Add data augmentation to training procedure
initial data augmentation function; needs to be tested
loss function for computing focal cross entropy
function for turning nested cell arrays into matrices
make labels logical instead of double
rename to camelCase; use f2 instead of f3
combine usable data into a single structure

Only compute stats on the positive frequencies

I think this is okay because the spectrum is conjugate symmetric,
so magnitude of the positive frequencies is the same as the mangitude
of the negative frequencies.

basic gplotmatrix wrapper to help visualize our feature distributions

Simplify std deviation and first difference calculations

Subtracting the mean before taking the std deviation and first
difference is unnecessary.

Feature Extraction and Augmentation

I am pushing the edited feature_extraction file becasue I found an error I made. The feature_augmentation is by no mean perfected, but I think it is accomplishing what we want. The last section of InsectLidarFeatureAugmentation_Labeling is how I ran it and looked looked at the changes via a scatter plot.

Merge pull request #2 from BMW-lab-MSU/label-creation

Extract labels for single folder
Various tests and preprocessing operations that I want to keep seperate from classification learner training script

Initial function for extracting insect labels

This function extracts insect labels for a single folder of insect lidar
data. The folder corresponds to a single data collection (varied over
pan/tilt angles) on a single day.

Create feature_extraction.m

This is the function to extract three features from each row. It is set up to read through an entire "adjusted_data_decembercal" file
moving code from afrl to insect specific
